title: 820-34374-B PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
message:
hi i have got a macbook air 820-3437-B with liquid damage when you connect it to the charger green/orange light turns on but fan doesn't spin there was some corrosion around U6100 and SMC so i cleaned it up, on L7140 i got 1.8V that meant so i removed L7140 and pin number 2 is shorted to ground when i send 4V to pin number 2 the only thing that heats up is the CPU, on the schematic PPBUS_G3H doesn't go to CPU (PCH) also i checked for more shorted lines and i found all of the bellow rails are shorted to ground

PPBUS_G3H
PPBUS_G3H_R
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS
PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCACLKPLL_R

with diode mode it shows 0010 on both sides

i tried to remove some caps around the CPU but the short is still there, the problem can't find the short by detecting the heat because the only part that gets hot is the PCH

thanks

title: 820-34374-B PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
message: Probably s5_computing_isns that's shorting ppbus. Check all the tantalum caps on the front side of board...sometimes it's one of them that pops.

title: 820-34374-B PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
message: Thanks for replying back, i removed all the tantalum caps and the short is still there there are some iC's on s5_computing_isns they can cause the short but i'm afraid of the PCH itself is shorted from inside, i looked for corrosion around CPU and it looks clean

title: 820-34374-B PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
message: Remove the fuse and check resistance to ground on pins 1 and 2 of where the fuse sits. You should get a short on one side of it. If it's on pin 2, inject low voltage first as the CPU sits on the system side.

title: 820-34374-B PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 35900"]Remove the fuse and check resistance to ground on pins 1 and 2 of where the fuse sits. You should get a short on one side of it. If it's on pin 2, inject low voltage first as the CPU sits on the system side.[/QUOTE]

yes i already did that and pin two is shorted to ground and when i inject voltage in only the CPU gets hot

title: 820-34374-B PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
message: High side FET in CPU Vcore supply shorted. CPU is dead already so this board can RIP.

title: 820-34374-B PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
message:
i injected 3.7V to PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCACLKPLL_R and U8080 got hot but U8080 is not connected to PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCACLKPLL_R directly so i checked the cap beside it (C8081) that has P5VS0_FET_RAMP on it and it was shorted to ground i removed U8080 the short on  P5VS0_FET_RAMP and PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCACLKPLL_R is gone but the short on 
PPBUS_G3H
PPBUS_G3H_R
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS

is still there

title: 820-34374-B PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 35940"]High side FET in CPU Vcore supply shorted. CPU is dead already so this board can RIP.[/QUOTE]

Thanks for that mate you saved my time i doubted the CPU itself can be shorted but i wan't sure, now i can give up on this and work on something else thanks alot
